metadata.Title: CVE-2021-35584 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Cluster product of Oracle MySQL (component: Cluster: ndbcluster/plugin DDL). Supported versions that are affected are 8.0.26 and prior. Easily exploitable vulnerability allows low privileged attacker with network access via multiple protocols to compromise MySQL Cluster. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in unauthorized ability to cause a partial denial of service (partial DOS) of MySQL Cluster. CVSS 3.1 Base Score 4.3 (Availability impacts). CVSS Vector: (CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:L).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-35584` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient21 - 8.0.27-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
mysql-client - 8.0.27-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
mysql-client-8.0 - 8.0.27-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
mysql-client-core-8.0 - 8.0.27-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
mysql-router - 8.0.27-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
mysql-server - 8.0.27-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
mysql-server-8.0 - 8.0.27-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
mysql-server-core-8.0 - 8.0.27-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
mysql-source-8.0 - 8.0.27-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
mysql-testsuite - 8.0.27-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
mysql-testsuite-8.0 - 8.0.27-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: leosilva> since 5.5 is no longer upstream supported and so far we cannot patch it, marking it as ignored.

criterions.comment: mysql-8.0 package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8.0.27-0ubuntu0.21.10.1').
